The attention meter indicates the intensity of a user’s level of mental focus or attention, such as that which occurs during intense concentration and directed (but stable) mental activity.

Attention can be controlled through a visual focus. Also, you can focus on singular idea.

You can try to "funnel" your concentration and focus your train of thought towards pushing up the meter.

Other suggestions include picking a point one screen to stare at or imagining the action you are trying to accomplish happening.

Also, look at the Attention meter and imagine the dial moving towards higher numbers.

Here you can control brightness level of the smart bulb.\nDynamic meter which is depicted below shows you the level of your attentiveness. Use it to monitor your mind activity.\nThe higher level of your attention the brighter the bulb.

Here you can control color of the smart bulb.\nDynamic meter which which is depicted below shows you the level of your attentiveness and color which the bulb will get from your mind efforts. Use it to monitor your mind activity.\nThe higher level of your attention the redder the bulb. If you are not concentrated then the smart lamp becomes greener.

Here you can switch on and off your smart bulb.\nDynamic scale shows level of your attentiveness and two threshold values.\nWhen your mind becomes more active then the bulb is on. Vice versa, when you become unfocused and level of attention is below the lower threshold for some time then the lamp will be off.

Mind relaxation (or meditation) meter indicates the level of a user's mental “calmness” or “relaxation”. Its value ranges from 0 to 100.
Note that meditation is a measure of a person's mental states, not physical levels, so simply relaxing all the muscles of the body may not immediately result in a heightened mind relaxation or meditation level.

However, for most people in most normal circumstances, relaxing the body often helps the mind to relax as well.

Meditation is related to reduced activity by the active mental processes in the brain. It has long been an observed effect that closing one`s eyes turns off the mental activities which process images from the eyes. So closing the eyes is often an effective method for increasing the meditation meter level.
Distractions, wandering thoughts, anxiety, agitation, and sensory stimuli may lower the meditation meter levels.

Here you can control brightness level of the smart bulb.\nDynamic meter is depicted below and shows you the level of your mind relaxation. Use it to monitor your mind relaxation.\nThe higher level of your relaxation the weaker the brightness of the bulb.

Here you can control color of the smart bulb.\nDynamic meter which depicted below shows the level of your mind relaxation and color which the bulb will get from this level. Use it to monitor your meditation level.\nThe higher level of meditation the bluer and purpler the bulb. If you are not relaxed then the smart lamp becomes greener.

Here you can switch on and off your smart bulb.\nDynamic scale shows level of relaxation of your mind and two threshold values.\nWhen your mind becomes more relaxed then the bulb is on - this is meditation state. Vice versa, when you become active and level of relaxation is below the lower threshold (during some time) then the lamp will be off.

Here you can control brightness level of the smart bulb.
Two dynamic meters are depicted below. They are ascending and descending in opposite directions. 
Third meter appears when levels of attention and relaxation is high enough (red bar and magenta bar overlap).
The longer overlap (gray bar) the brighter the bulb.
This promote your ability to keep high levels of attention and relaxation at the same time.

Here you can control color of the smart bulb.\nThree stripes are shown below. When levels of your attention and mind relaxation are about on the same level bulb becomes yellow. When attention prevails over relaxation then bulb\'s color is red. And if your mind is relaxed then bulb emits magenta color.\nColors of the stripes are changing correspondingly.
